text:
In this video, we will
show you different ways
you can play Minecraft with friends.

We will show you how
to join public servers,

how to play on private servers,
and how to play on realms.

Use the clickable sections
below to skip to each method.
There are many popular Minecraft servers

available for you and
your friends to join.

To join a server, you will
need to have its IP address.

To find an IP address
for a specific server,
you can search online for the server's IP.

The website used here is
Topminecraftservers.org,

which will be linked in
the description below.

Once you have the IP,
click on "Multiplayer."

To immediately join a server,
click on "Direct Connection."
Enter the server's IP in the slot
and then click on "Join Server."

If you would like to add a
server to your servers list,
click on "Add Server."
Enter the IP in the server address slot.

You can also enter a
name under "Server Name."

Once you've entered all the
details, click on "Done."

This will add the server
to your servers list

and make it easier for
you to join the server
without entering the IP each time.
Another way to play Minecraft with friends
is to have your very own server.
If your friend has their own server,

they can send you the
IP for you to join it
and play with them.
You can also create your own server
and invite friends to join it.

If you would like to know
how to create your own server
and port forward it

so that you can allow your
friends to connect to it,

we will link two video tutorials
in the description below.

You can also play with
friends through LAN.
This is only possible
if friends are within your local network.

For example, if your friend
is connected to your WiFi,

you can create a LAN
world for them to join.
To do this, click on "Singleplayer."

You can join an existing
world or create a new one.
Once you've joined the world,

go to your in-game menu by
pressing the escape key,
then click on "Open to LAN."
You can change the game mode

and whether or not you'd
like to enable cheats.
Then click on "Start LAN World."
Anyone that's on your local network
will now be able to join your world
through the multiplayer tab.

You can also create a
realm and invite friends.
Realms allow up to 10 players to join.
It also includes options for mini games
and many custom worlds,

and it's much easier
than creating a server.

Once you've opened Minecraft,
click on "Minecraft Realms."
You will be given an option
to either get a trial or buy a realm.
If you click on "Buy a realm,"

you will be taken to the
Minecraft.net website,

where you can select a
plan to purchase a realm.

After buying your realm,
go back into Minecraft
and go to the "Minecraft Realms" tab.
A green text saying

"Click to start your
new realm" will appear.
Click on the text to begin.
Once your realm is created, click on it,
then click on "Play" to join it.
In order for friends to join your realm,
you will need to send them an invite.
To do this, click on your realm,
then click on "Configure realm,"

or you can click on the tool
icon next to your realm.
Then click on "Players."
Click "Invite player."
Enter the Minecraft username
of the friend you'd like to invite.
Then click "Invite player."

This will add the player to
the invited list on the left.
If you're invited to join a realm,
click on the Minecraft Realms tab.

You will then see a small
envelope icon at the top.

By clicking it, you will be
able to accept the invite,
and your friend's realm will now appear
on your realms list for you to join.
